meanings.definition: A line of persons or things arranged one behind another.
meanings.sent1: The students stood in a fyle to enter the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The ants formed a fyle as they carried food back to their nest.
meanings.sent3: The ducks waddled in a fyle, looking like a parade.
meanings.sent4: The trees in the forest stood in a fyle, like soldiers guarding the path.
meanings.sent5: The books on the shelf were neatly placed in a fyle, making it easy to find each one.

meanings.definition: To arrange in a line or row.
meanings.sent1: Please fyle the papers neatly on the desk.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to fyle up for the school photo.
meanings.sent3: I will fyle the toys in a row before we start playing.
meanings.sent4: She fyled the flowers in the vase, creating a beautiful display.
meanings.sent5: The chef fyled the ingredients on the cutting board before starting to cook.

meanings.sent1: The soldiers began to fyle out of the barracks for the morning drill.
meanings.sent2: The penguins fyled across the icy terrain in search of food.
meanings.sent3: The ants fyled in a straight line, carrying leaves back to their nest.
meanings.sent4: The students fyled into the auditorium for the school assembly.
meanings.sent5: The geese fyled gracefully in the sky, forming a perfect V shape.
